00113 void
00114 tsv_util_linecount(const std::string& fileName)
00115 {
00116   int rv;
00117   int data_lines;
00118   affx::TsvFile* tsv;
00119 
00120   tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00121   rv=tsv->open(fileName);
00122 
00123   printf("%-40s: ",fileName.c_str());
00124   if (rv!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00125     printf("ERR=%d\n",rv);
00126     return;
00127   }
00128 
00129   std::string str;
00130   data_lines=0;
00131   while (tsv->nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
00132     data_lines++;
00133     //tsv->get(0,0,str);
00134     //printf("%s\n",str.c_str());
00135   }
00136   printf("datalines=%d\n",data_lines);
00137   tsv->close();
00138 }

00141 
00144 void
00145 tsv_util_headers(const std::string& fileName)
00146 {
00147   int rv;
00148   affx::TsvFile* tsv;
00149   std::string key,val;
00150 
00151   tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00152   rv=tsv->open(fileName);
00153 
00154   if (rv!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00155     printf("%s: ERR=%d\n",fileName.c_str(),rv);
00156     delete tsv;
00157     return;
00158   }
00159 
00160   tsv->headersBegin();
00161   while (tsv->headersNext(key,val)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00162     // tack on the "#%" so it looks the same as it does in the file.
00163     printf("#%%%s=%s\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
00164   }
00165   tsv->close();
00166   delete tsv;
00167 }

00170 
00171 int
00172 tsv_util_print_duplicate_headerkeys(const std::string& fileName)
00173 {
00174   int rv;
00175   affx::TsvFile* tsv;
00176 
00177   tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00178   rv=tsv->open(fileName);
00179 
00180   if (rv!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00181     printf("%s: ERR=%d\n",fileName.c_str(),rv);
00182     delete tsv;
00183     return 1;
00184   }
00185 
00186   int cnt=tsv->printDuplicateHeaders();
00187 
00188   tsv->close();
00189   delete tsv;
00190 
00191   return (cnt==0)?0:1;
00192 }

00195 
00200 void
00201 tsv_util_copy(const std::string& f_fileName,const std::string& t_fileName,int fmt)
00202 {
00203   affx::TsvFile* f_tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00204   affx::TsvFile* t_tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00205 
00206   //
00207   f_tsv->open(f_fileName);
00208   //
00209   t_tsv->copyFormat(*f_tsv); // better name?
00210   t_tsv->addHeadersFrom(*f_tsv,affx::TSV_ADD_ALL);
00211 
00212   //
00213   if (fmt==1) {
00214     t_tsv->writeCsv(t_fileName);
00215   } else if (fmt==2) {
00216     t_tsv->writeTsv(t_fileName);
00217   } else {
00218     assert(0);
00219   }
00220 
00221   while (f_tsv->nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
00222     t_tsv->copyLevel(*f_tsv,f_tsv->lineLevel());
00223     t_tsv->writeLevel(f_tsv->lineLevel());
00224   }
00225 
00226   t_tsv->close();
00227   f_tsv->close();
00228 }

00231 
00233 // #define TSV_PASTE_FH_LIMIT 900
00234 // for testing
00235 #define TSV_PASTE_FH_LIMIT 900
00236 
00246 void
00247 tsv_util_paste_basic(const std::string& out_fileName,
00248                      const std::vector<std::string> in_tsv_fileNames,
00249                      const std::vector<std::string> in_header_fileNames,
00250                      int seg_max_lines,
00251                      const std::string& key_col_name,
00252                      int verbose)
00253 {
00254   std::vector<affx::TsvFile*> in_tsv;
00255   std::vector<int> in_tsv_key_cidx;
00256   affx::TsvFile out_tsv;
00257   int o_cidx;
00258   int seg_count=0;
00259   int out_tsv_lines=0;
00260 
00261   //
00262   if (in_tsv_fileNames.size()>TSV_PASTE_FH_LIMIT) {
00263     // @todo: why doesnt '#TSV_PASTE_FH_LIMIT' work here?
00264     Err::errAbort("tsv-paste: Can only paste " +ToStr(TSV_PASTE_FH_LIMIT)+
00265                   " tsv files at at time. (unix fh limit.)");
00266   }
00267 
00268   //
00269   if (seg_max_lines<0) {
00270     Err::errAbort("tsv-paste: seg_max_lines must be 0 (disabled) a postive number.");
00271   }
00272 
00273   // some output for the user
00274   if (verbose>=2) {
00275     for (int i=0;i<in_tsv_fileNames.size();i++) {
00276       printf("# %3d : %s\n",i,in_tsv_fileNames[i].c_str());
00277     }
00278     printf("# === > %s\n",out_fileName.c_str());
00279   }
00280 
00281   // the key_col_name might be numeric.
00282   char* key_col_name_ptr2;
00283   const char* key_col_name_ptr1=key_col_name.c_str();
00284   int key_col_num=strtol(key_col_name_ptr1,&key_col_name_ptr2,10);
00285   // not a full conversion.
00286   if (*key_col_name_ptr2!=0) {
00287     key_col_num=-1;
00288   }
00289 
00290   // scan the inputs to...
00291   for (int i=0;i<in_tsv_fileNames.size();i++) {
00292     // ...open
00293     affx::TsvFile* tsvp=new affx::TsvFile();
00294     tsvp->open(in_tsv_fileNames[i]);
00295     in_tsv.push_back(tsvp);
00296     //
00297     if (verbose>=3) {
00298       printf("tsv_paste: open '%s'\n",in_tsv_fileNames[i].c_str());
00299     }
00300     // ...check for key name.
00301     if (key_col_name=="") { // no key name
00302       in_tsv_key_cidx.push_back(-1);
00303     }
00304     else {
00305       int key_cidx;
00306       key_cidx=in_tsv[i]->cname2cidx(0,key_col_name);
00307       if (key_col_num>=0) {
00308         key_cidx=key_col_num;
00309       }
00310       else {
00311         Err::errAbort("tsv-paste: missing column '"+key_col_name+"' in input '"+in_tsv_fileNames[i]+"'");
00312       }
00313       if ((key_cidx<0)||(key_cidx>=in_tsv[i]->getColumnCount(0))) {
00314         Err::errAbort("tsv-paste: key column is out of bounds. (key_cidx="+ToStr(key_cidx)+")");
00315       }
00316       in_tsv_key_cidx.push_back(key_cidx);
00317     }
00318   }
00319 
00320   // ...add header info describing the input files used.
00321   for (int i=0;i<in_header_fileNames.size();i++) {
00322     char hdr_buf[100];
00323     SNPRINTF(hdr_buf,sizeof(hdr_buf),"paste-input-%05d",i);
00324     out_tsv.addHeader(hdr_buf,in_header_fileNames[i]);
00325   }
00326 
00327   // paste the column defs into the output tsv
00328   o_cidx=0;;
00329   for (int i=0;i<in_tsv.size();i++) {
00330     for (int c_idx=0;c_idx<in_tsv[i]->getColumnCount(0);c_idx++) {
00331       // only include the first check column, skip the rest.
00332       if ((c_idx!=in_tsv_key_cidx[i])||(i==0)) {
00333         out_tsv.defineColumn(0,o_cidx++,in_tsv[i]->getColumnName(0,c_idx));
00334       }
00335     }
00336   }
00337 
00338   // open the output file in the unsegmented case
00339   if (seg_max_lines==0) {
00340     out_tsv.writeTsv_v1(out_fileName);
00341   }
00342 
00343   // paste the column while we have rows.
00344   while (1) {
00345     // open a segmented output file as needed
00346     if ((seg_max_lines>0) && // have segments?
00347         ((out_tsv_lines>=seg_max_lines) || // hit seg size?
00348          ((seg_count==0)&&(out_tsv_lines==0)) // first time through?
00349          )) {
00350       char buf[300];
00351       sprintf(buf,"%s-%04d",out_fileName.c_str(),seg_count++);
00352       out_tsv.writeTsv_v1(buf);
00353       out_tsv_lines=0;
00354     };
00355 
00356     std::string key_col_value;
00357 
00358     bool more_lines=false;
00359     for (int i=0;i<in_tsv.size();i++) {
00360       if (in_tsv[i]->nextLevel(0)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00361         more_lines=true;
00362       }
00363     }
00364     if (!more_lines) {
00365       break;
00366     }
00367 
00368     // copy row data to the output tsv.
00369     o_cidx=0;
00370     for (int i=0;i<in_tsv.size();i++) {
00371       for (int i_cidx=0;i_cidx<in_tsv[i]->getColumnCount(0);i_cidx++) {
00372         // get the input.
00373         std::string tmp;
00374         int rv=in_tsv[i]->get(0,i_cidx,tmp);
00375         // is this a check column?
00376         if (i_cidx==in_tsv_key_cidx[i]) {
00377           // must be set
00378           if (rv!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00379             Err::errAbort("tsv-paste: Check column value is required. '"+in_tsv_fileNames[i]+"'");
00380           }
00381           // the first is the reference
00382           if (i==0) {
00383             out_tsv.set(0,o_cidx++,tmp);
00384             key_col_value=tmp;
00385           }
00386           else {
00387             if (tmp!=key_col_value) {
00388               Err::errAbort("tsv-paste: Check column mismatch.  "
00389                             "file='"+in_tsv_fileNames[i]+"' "
00390                             "line="+ToStr(in_tsv[i]->lineNum())+" "
00391                             "ref='"+key_col_value+"' "
00392                             "val='"+tmp+"'");
00393             }
00394           }
00395         }
00396         // a normal column
00397         else {
00398           out_tsv.set(0,o_cidx++,tmp);
00399         }
00400       }
00401     }
00402     //
00403     out_tsv.writeLevel(0);
00404     out_tsv_lines++;
00405 
00406   } // while
00407 
00408   // clean up
00409   out_tsv.close();
00410   //
00411   for (int i=0;i<in_tsv.size();i++) {
00412     in_tsv[i]->close();
00413     delete in_tsv[i];
00414   }
00415 }
00416 
00426 void
00427 tsv_util_paste(const std::string& out_fileName,
00428                const std::vector<std::string> in_tsv_fileNames,
00429                int seg_max_lines,
00430                const std::string& key_col_name,
00431                int verbose,
00432                int tsv_paste_fh_limit)
00433 {
00434   // the simple case, no passes needed...
00435   if (in_tsv_fileNames.size()<=tsv_paste_fh_limit) {
00436     // ...so just do it.
00437     tsv_util_paste_basic(out_fileName,
00438                          in_tsv_fileNames,in_tsv_fileNames,
00439                          seg_max_lines,key_col_name,verbose);
00440     // and we are done.
00441     return;
00442   }
00443 
00444   // complex case, passes are needed.
00445   if (verbose>=1) {
00446     printf("tsv_util_paste: multiple passes needed to process '%d' inputs.\n",
00447            int(in_tsv_fileNames.size()));
00448   }
00449 
00450   // we have to be able to open at least two files at a time.
00451   if (tsv_paste_fh_limit<=1) {
00452     Err::errAbort("tsv_paste_fh_limit must be bigger than 2.");
00453   }
00454 
00455   //
00456   std::vector<std::string> copy_fileNames=in_tsv_fileNames;
00457   //
00458   int pass_cnt=0;
00459   std::string pass0_out_name;
00460   std::string pass1_out_name;
00461   std::vector<std::string> pass_out_names;
00462   std::vector<std::string> pass1_fileNames;
00463 
00464   // while we have more than the limit, we need to use a temp file.
00465   while (copy_fileNames.size()>tsv_paste_fh_limit) {
00466     pass1_fileNames.clear();
00467     // tack on the prior tmp file.
00468     if (pass0_out_name!="") {
00469       pass1_fileNames.push_back(pass0_out_name);
00470     }
00471     // add some more input files.
00472     // dont adjust the length for the file we pushed on.
00473     int len=tsv_paste_fh_limit;
00474     pass1_fileNames.insert(pass1_fileNames.end(),
00475                            copy_fileNames.begin(),copy_fileNames.begin()+len);
00476     copy_fileNames.erase(copy_fileNames.begin(),copy_fileNames.begin()+len);
00477     // gen the name for the new temp file.
00478     char buf[100];
00479     SNPRINTF(buf,sizeof(buf),"-%05d.tmp",pass_cnt);
00480     pass1_out_name=out_fileName+buf;
00481     pass_out_names.push_back(pass1_out_name);
00482     //
00483     if (verbose>=1) {
00484       printf("pass: %d : '%s'...\n",pass_cnt,pass1_out_name.c_str());
00485     }
00486     // paste what we have into the new tmp file.
00487     tsv_util_paste_basic(pass1_out_name,
00488                          pass1_fileNames,
00489                          pass1_fileNames, // the filenames in this pass
00490                          0, // dont segment.
00491                          key_col_name,verbose);
00492     // get rid of the old tmp file.
00493     if (pass0_out_name!="") {
00494       //printf("rm %s\n",pass0_out_name.c_str());
00495       Util::fileRemove(pass0_out_name);
00496     }
00497     // the current is now the old.
00498     pass_cnt++;
00499     pass0_out_name=pass1_out_name;
00500   }
00501   // now do the last pass into the official output file.
00502   pass1_fileNames.clear();
00503   if (pass0_out_name!="") {
00504     pass1_fileNames.push_back(pass0_out_name);
00505   }
00506   pass1_fileNames.insert(pass1_fileNames.end(),copy_fileNames.begin(),copy_fileNames.end());
00507   tsv_util_paste_basic(out_fileName, // the final output file
00508                        pass1_fileNames,
00509                        in_tsv_fileNames, // the filenames for all the inputs.
00510                        seg_max_lines, // do segment if needed.
00511                        key_col_name,verbose);
00512   // and get rid of it.
00513   Util::fileRemove(pass0_out_name);
00514 }
00515 
00517 
00518 #define BENCHMARK_COL_CNT 10
00519 
00520 void
00521 tsv_util_benchmark(int benchmark_cnt,const std::string& filename)
00522 {
00523   if (benchmark_cnt<=0) {
00524     printf("Need to write at least one double.");
00525     return;
00526   }
00527   if (filename=="") {
00528     printf("Need to give a file to write to.");
00529     return;
00530   }
00531 
00532   int rv;
00533   affx::TsvFile* tsv;
00534 
00535   tsv=new affx::TsvFile();
00536 
00537   tsv->addHeader("benchmark-cnt",benchmark_cnt);
00538   tsv->addHeader("benchmark-file",filename);
00539 
00540   for (int col=0;col<BENCHMARK_COL_CNT;col++) {
00541     char buf[100];
00542     sprintf(buf,"col-%04d",col);
00543     tsv->defineColumn(0,col,buf);
00544   }
00545 
00546   rv=tsv->writeTsv_v1(filename);
00547 
00548   int cnt=0;
00549   while (cnt<benchmark_cnt) {
00550     for (int c=0;c<BENCHMARK_COL_CNT;c++) {
00551       tsv->set(0,c,(cnt++)+0.123456);
00552     }
00553     tsv->writeLevel(0);
00554   }
00555   //
00556   tsv->close();
00557 }

00560 
00565 int
00566 main(int argc,const char* argv[])
00567 {
00568   int rv=0;
00569   PgOptions* opts=new PgOptions();
00570   //
00571   opts->setUsage("Utility functions for tsv files."
00572                  "\n"
00573                  "\n"
00574                  );
00575   //
00576   opts->defineOption("h","help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00577                      "This message.",
00578                      "false");
00579   opts->defineOption("v","verbose",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00580                      "verbose level",
00581                      "0");
00582 
00583   opts->defineOption("","headers", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00584                      "INFILE = Display the headers of the CSV/TSV file.",
00585                      "false");
00586   opts->defineOption("","linecount", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00587                      "INFILE = count the lines of data in the file.",
00588                      "false");
00589   opts->defineOption("","to-csv", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00590                      "INFILE OUTFILE = Covert the file to CVS format.",
00591                      "false");
00592   opts->defineOption("","to-tsv", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00593                      "INFILE OUTFILE = Convert the file to TSV format.",
00594                      "false");
00595   //
00596   opts->defineOption("","paste", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00597                      "OUTFILE  FILELIST = Paste the files of filelist into outfile.",
00598                      "");
00599   opts->defineOption("","seg-lines",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00600                      "Segment size",
00601                      "0");
00602   opts->defineOption("","key-col", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00603                      "COLUMN_NAME = Column name which must be present and equal in all inputs files, if set.",
00604                      "");
00605   opts->defineOption("","max-paste-fh", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00606                      "CNT = Max number of files to paste in one pass.",
00607                      "900");
00608   //
00609   opts->defineOption("","benchmark", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00610                      "Number of doubles to write for benchmarking output.",
00611                      "0");
00612   opts->defineOption("","output", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00613                      "Output file for some operations.",
00614                      "");
00615   //
00616   opts->defineOption("","diff",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00617                      "Compare headers and data of two tsv formatted files. "
00618                      "There are a number of options to control printing of the diff.",
00619                      "false");
00620   //
00621   opts->defineOption("","diff-headers",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00622                      "BOOL = Compare the headers of the files.",
00623                      "true");
00624   opts->defineOption("","diff-data",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00625                      "BOOL = Compare the data in the files.",
00626                      "true");
00627   //
00628   opts->defineOption("","diff-print-linenums",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00629                      "BOOL = Print line numbers from where the lines are from (file1:file2).",
00630                      "true");
00631   opts->defineOption("","diff-print-same",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00632                      "BOOL = Print lines which are the same. "
00633                      "(otherwise only changed lines.)",
00634                      "false");
00635   opts->defineOption("","diff-print-max",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00636                      "NUM = Max number of lines to print. (-1=> all)",
00637                      "-1");
00638   opts->defineOption("","diff-print-format",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00639                      "[1 or 2] = Select the format of the displayed diffs, one or two lines.",
00640                      "1");
00641   opts->defineOption("","diff-max-diff",PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00642                      "NUM = Numerical differences smaller than than this are ignored.",
00643                      "0.00001");
00644   opts->defineOption("","diff-residuals",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00645                      "FILENAME = File to output residuals to. (file1-file2)",
00646                      "");
00647 
00648   opts->defineOption("","print-duplicate-headerkeys",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00649                      "Print the duplicate headers.",
00650                      "0");
00651   
00652   //
00653   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00654 
00655   //
00656   if (opts->getBool("help")||(argc==1)) {
00657     opts->usage();
00658     exit(0);
00659   }
00660 
00661   else if (opts->getBool("linecount")) {
00662     for (int a=0;a<opts->getArgCount();a++) {
00663       tsv_util_linecount(opts->getArg(a));
00664     }
00665   }
00666   else if (opts->getBool("headers")) {
00667     for (int a=0;a<opts->getArgCount();a++) {
00668       tsv_util_headers(opts->getArg(a));
00669     }
00670   }
00671 
00672   // Conversions
00673   else if (opts->getBool("to-csv")) {
00674     if (opts->getArgCount()<2) {
00675       printf("Need two args.");
00676       opts->usage();
00677     }
00678     tsv_util_copy(opts->getArg(0),opts->getArg(1),1);
00679   }
00680   else if (opts->getBool("to-tsv")) {
00681     if (opts->getArgCount()<2) {
00682       printf("Need two args.");
00683       opts->usage();
00684     }
00685     tsv_util_copy(opts->getArg(0),opts->getArg(1),2);
00686   }
00687 
00688   //
00689   else if (opts->get("paste")!="") {
00690     tsv_util_paste(opts->get("paste"),
00691                    opts->getArgVector(),
00692                    opts->getInt("seg-lines"),
00693                    opts->get("key-col"),
00694                    opts->getInt("verbose"),
00695                    opts->getInt("max-paste-fh"));
00696   }
00697   //
00698   else if (opts->getBool("diff")||opts->getBool("diff-headers")||opts->getBool("diff-data")) {
00699     if (opts->getArgCount()!=2) {
00700       printf("Need exactly two args.");
00701       opts->usage();
00702     }
00703     else {
00704       // --diff implies both headers and data
00705       if (opts->getBool("diff")) {
00706         if (!opts->mustFindOpt("diff-headers")->isSet()) {
00707           opts->mustFindOpt("diff-headers")->setValue("1");
00708         }
00709         if (!opts->mustFindOpt("diff-data")->isSet()) {
00710           opts->mustFindOpt("diff-data")->setValue("1");
00711         }
00712       }
00713       //
00714       affx::TsvFileDiff diff;
00715       // set our options
00716       diff.m_opt_do_headers=opts->getBool("diff-headers");
00717       diff.m_opt_do_data=opts->getBool("diff-data");
00718       //
00719       diff.m_opt_print_linenums=opts->getBool("diff-print-linenums");
00720       diff.m_opt_print_same=opts->getBool("diff-print-same");
00721       diff.m_opt_print_format=opts->getInt("diff-print-format");
00722       diff.m_opt_print_max=opts->getInt("diff-print-max");
00723       diff.m_opt_max_diff=opts->getDouble("diff-max-diff");
00724       diff.m_residuals_filename=opts->get("diff-residuals");
00725       //diff.m_residuals_filename=opts->getArg(1)+".residuals";
00726       // do the diff
00727       diff.diff(opts->getArg(0),opts->getArg(1));
00728       //
00729       if (diff.m_diff_cnt!=0) {
00730         printf("### %d diff\n",diff.m_diff_cnt);
00731       }
00732     }
00733   }
00734   //
00735   else if (opts->getBool("print-duplicate-headerkeys")) {
00736     int cnt=0;
00737     for (int i=0;i<opts->getArgCount();i++) {
00738       if (tsv_util_print_duplicate_headerkeys(opts->getArg(i))) {
00739         cnt++;
00740       }
00741     }
00742     // dont fiddle with the exit value.
00743     // rv=(cnt==0)?0:1;
00744   }
00745   //
00746   else if (opts->getInt("benchmark")!=0) {
00747     tsv_util_benchmark(opts->getInt("benchmark"),opts->get("output"));
00748   }
00749 
00750   //
00751   delete opts;
00752   return rv;
00753 }
